Language.Sentence: The Container type produces an object that allows logical and visual uniting several objects.It is transparent by default. Other VDOM objects can be inserted into the Container object, they have left-top coordinates relative to the left upper corner of the Container object. Note, that when you move an object onto the Container object, the borders must become highlighted with green. If they are highlighted with red, this object cannot be nested into the Container object.
The background color of the object in the WYSIWYG mode of VDOM IDE. It helps to navigate the objects of the page if there are too many of them.
Order of rendering the object on the page. By default the value of hierarchy is 0, that means, that the object will be rendered in the order it is written in the XML-file of the VDOM application.

Position in visual hierarchy of objects. If you have several objects in one container situated on each other, the z-index indicates the order of their displaying. The larger z-index is, the upper the object lies.
Spacing between the top edge of the container and the object in pixels.
Spacing between the left edge of the container and the object in pixels..
Width of the object in pixels.
Height of the object in pixels.
The container title. The title is displayed only if the Title appearance attribute is set not to "Title off".
The title appearance parameters. The title to display is set in the Title attribute.

Define if the Container moves to the bottom of the page or not (Off, On). If the Footer mode attribute is on, the Container will be displayed lower than the other objects. If this attribute is off, the Container will be displayed as in WYSIWYG.
Define the security code of the container. If it is set (it must be an integer), the Container will not be displayed until you pass this security code to the page on its rendering.

The overflow control mode: Auto - if the content fits in the object' borders - scrolling will not be shown; if not - the scrolling will be shown; Hidden - if the content does not fit in the object' borders - it will be cropped within the borders; Scroll - the horizontal and vertical scrolling will always be shown, no matter if the content fits or not; Visible - the whole content will always be shown without reference to the object's borders.
The color of the background of the object (can be set as a hexadecimal number or as a word, for example, "olive", "blue").
Incorrect value, must be either 0 or 1.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 99.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer
Incorrect value, must be positive integer | auto.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer | auto.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer | auto.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer | auto.
The background image of the object. Can be set together with the Background color attribute.

The way of displaying the background image: no-repeat - the image is not repeated and situated at the top left; repeat - the image is repeated in the whole Container; repeat-x - the image is repeated along the x-axis; repeat-y - the image is repeated along the y-axis.
Move object to the selected point
Change position in visual hierarchy of objects
Start changing width of the object
Start changing width of the object
Start changing size of the object
Start changing height of the object
Fade effect, time is indicated in milliseconds.
Fade effect, time is indicated in milliseconds.
Visual effect of moving, time is indicated in milliseconds.
Fade effect, time is indicated in milliseconds.
Fade effect, time is indicated in milliseconds.
The background color of the object in the WYSIWYG mode of VDOM IDE. It helps to navigate the objects of the page if there are too many of them.
Hiérarchie de l'objet, ordre de chargement de l'objet par rapport aux autres
Niveau de superposition de l'objet par rapport aux autres
Distance depuis le bord haut de l'objet parent en pixels
Distance depuis le bord gauche de l'objet parent en pixels
Conteneur utilisé comme Pied de page
The color of the background of the object (can be set as a hexadecimal number or as a word, for example, "olive", "blue").
The background image of the object. Can be set together with the Background color attribute.

The way of displaying the background image: no-repeat - the image is not repeated and situated at the top left; repeat - the image is repeated in the whole Container; repeat-x - the image is repeated along the x-axis; repeat-y - the image is repeated along the y-axis.

The way of displaying the background image: no-repeat - the image is not repeated and situated at the top left; repeat - the image is repeated in the whole Container; repeat-x - the image is repeated along the x-axis; repeat-y - the image is repeated along the y-axis.
